author: ztrhgf
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# start powershell under !different! user
Start-Process powershell.exe -Credential (Get-Credential) -ArgumentList "-noprofile"

```
start typing any text to both of the consoles

# Expected behavior

```none
both consoles will be completely independent and wont be stucked

```

# Actual behavior

```none
almost every time, one of the consoles will be "stucked" so nothing will be outputted while you are typing. But when you switch to other console and start typing, queued input in first "stucked" console will be outputted

here is video of this behaviour https://www.dropbox.com/s/lcs88jk2gk2bllr/PSproblem.mp4?dl=0

When I run powershell using "run as different user" from START menu it works without any problem
```

# Environment data
```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
